About Heber City, Utah

If you’re looking for a beautiful vacation destination minutes away from the famous Park City Utah, Heber Valley is your spot. And with Casago, you’ll be able to book the perfect getaway! First settled in 1859, it’s most known for its stunning beauty, the Provo River, and sheep farms. Taking up a large portion of Wasatch County, Heber Valley is surrounded on all sides by the towering Uintah mountain range and the iconic Mount Timpanogos. Boasting 2 beautiful reservoirs and split by 10 miles of the Middle Provo River famous for blue ribbon fly fishing, the valley has a majesty that is singular and special to Utah. Only minutes from Utah's famous Wasatch ski resorts, rivers known for world class fly fishing, hundreds of miles of snowmobiling, hiking, UTV and mountain bike trails, 5 golf courses, thousands of acres of protected forest, endless high alpine and water related recreation opportunities, Heber Valley is truly an outdoor paradise.

Within Heber Valley are the cities of Heber City, Midway, Charleston, Daniel, Strawberry, Red Ledges, Timber Lakes, Center Creek, Lake Creek, Wallsburg and Benloch Ranch. So you’ll want to make sure to book plenty of time to explore as each quaint city within Heber Valley offers a unique identity— many boasting fun local events and dining, cultural attractions and more. Heber City and Midway provide unique settings for frequent festivals and other community activities such as the Heber Valley Historic Railroad, Swiss Days, Cowboy Poetry, Rodeos, Skijoring, and the world famous Sundance Film Festival. And if skiing is your thing, Soldier Hollow Nordic Ski Area, known as the Cross Country and Biathlon Olympic Venue for the 2002 Winter Olympics is still the most prolific Nordic venue in the United States and hosts numerous winter and summer events open to the public.
